title: Bug 38131: ajc needs '-d' option while correctly compiling classes from subpackage
description:
I am using 1.1rc1. This is a regression since rc1 and a deviation from javac. I am guessing this may have something to do with a change in the underlying Eclipse compiler.

To reproduce:
1. Create a class in a subpackage:
   package subpackage;

   public class Test {
        public static void main(String[] args) {
            System.out.println("Hello");
        }
   }

2. Compile the class using the following command:
   ajc subpackage\Test.java

Observed Behavior:
The test.class file is then put in the 'subpackage\subpackage' directory, instead of the 'subpackage' directory.

Expected Behavior:
Running the command 'java subpackage.Test' results in the error:
   Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: subpackage/Test

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Compile the class using the following command:
   ajc -d . subpackage\Test.java

Expected Behavior:
Running the command 'java subpackage.Test' should execute without any errors.
OB:
The test.class file is then put in 'subpackage\subpackage' directory. Running the command 'java subpackage.Test' results in the error:
   Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: subpackage/Test
EB: Running the command 'java subpackage.Test' should execute without any errors.
SR:
Compile the class using the following command:
   ajc -d . subpackage\Test.java
